content:
PathGeometry Class

Definition

Represents a complex shape that may be composed of arcs, curves, ellipses, lines, and rectangles.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("Figures")]
public sealed class PathGeometry : System.Windows.Media.Geometry

Remarks

Each PathGeometry object defines a collection of PathFigure objects. Each of the PathFigure objects is composed of one or more PathSegment objects, such as ArcSegment and LineSegment, which actually define their shape.

The filled area of the PathGeometry is defined by taking all of the contained PathFigure objects that have their IsFilled property set to true and applying the FillRule to determine the enclosed area.

Figures

Gets or sets the collection of PathFigure objects that describe the path's contents.

public System.Windows.Media.PathFigureCollection Figures { get; set; }
Value
PathFigureCollection

A collection of PathFigure objects that describe the path's contents. Each individual PathFigure describes a shape.

Attributes
ContentPropertyAttribute

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object Figures="moveAndDrawCommands"/>

XAML Property Element Usage

<object>  
  <object.Figures>  
    oneOrMoreFigures  
  </object.Figures>  
</object>

XAML Values

moveAndDrawCommands
One or more move and draw commands. See Path Markup Syntax.

oneOrMoreFigures
System.Windows.Media.PathFigure

One or more PathFigure objects.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field FiguresProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

FillRule

Gets or sets a value that determines how the intersecting areas contained in this PathGeometry are combined.

public System.Windows.Media.FillRule FillRule { get; set; }
Value
FillRule

Indicates how the intersecting areas of this PathGeometry are combined. The default value is EvenOdd.

Attributes
ContentPropertyAttribute

Remarks

EvenOdd Determines the "insideness" of a point on the shape by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

NonZero Determines the "insideness" of a point on the shape by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a Segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path. Otherwise, it is inside.


FillRule Example

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field FillRuleProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Remarks

If the specified geometry is animated, its current animated values are used when constructing the new PathGeometry (although the animations themselves are not copied). If the geometry is animated, the conversion may result in some loss of precision.
